lines.text: My husband declares that I was simply born to be a writer. He says if anyone just took a pencil and followed me around, they'd have a novel.
My dear lady, I should be delighted to get behind you with a pencil.
A pinch is a pinch in any man's language.
Why can't women play the game properly? Everyone knows that in love affairs only the man has the right to lie.
These girls in love never realize that they should be honestly dishonest instead of being dishonestly honest.
[Walking down a street in Rome, Maria gets a pinch from a fresh young Italian man]
Don't look back. It's considered an encouragement. Just pretend you didn't notice.
Are you kidding? I'll kick him right in his antipasto!
You can't be as antisocial as you are and still expect people to know you're alive.
Meeting Mama in Italy is the first step to the alter.
Don't forget, I knew you when you were still running around in three-cornered pants.
Hello. I'm Maria Williams. We met at the Burgoyne's, Mr. Shadwell, but I'm sure you don't remember me.
You're quite wrong. I remember you very well. It's the party I've forgotten.
Punctuality is the vice of virtuous women.
Well, different pictures say different things to different people.
Yes, but the right paintings say the right things to the right people.
